intro: Piper capacibracteum, commonly known as the broad-bract pepper or the Amazonian pepper, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that develop into elongated, berry-like fruits. The fruits are typically harvested when ripe and used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
